result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan L. Burke

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michelle M. Gardner in court for Ryan L. Burke. Defendant Ryan L. Burke appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. DE has picked up a new case. Attorney Gaertner would like all cases on her week. Attorney Gardner states that that she still needs to get discover and review it.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
WCS Notice of Non-Compliance, specifically by being arrested on a new criminal charge.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Bub.  Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Bub states he needs to look into the previous cases. STC set to 09/23/22 at 8:30.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment.
Assessment of Costs for Blood Draws/ Prosecution Costs -- $65.00
Assessment of Costs for Expert Laboratory Analysis and Witness Fees -- $70.00
Letter from DE, Ryan Burke (pro-se) to Judge dated 4/14/22

Defendant, Ryan L. Burke, appeared with Attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Intern Daniel Bernard Deida with Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 2.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Branch 2 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment and pay the remaining $350 balance on the client service fee.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  If released, Report to WCS by 11:00 the next business day; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.

141PM    Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Christopher Bub.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.  $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  ts
and witness list filed by the State
